reviews.review_msg: Took this course some years ago. Like many students, I felt entirely let down by the lecturer. The lecture was all over the place. I am very surprised by the sudden shift in ratings (from very negative to very positive).
Great Teacher, No-nonsense, professional attitude.

Professor Anjum was hands down the best professor at SFU. Every lecture shows how passionate they are about the environment and climate change. Her lectures are interesting and I found her case studies very helpful. Now that I am taking other courses, I still go back to Dr Anjum's PowerPoint slides for help.
Had two courses with her and she was amazing in both. The lectures were interesting and thorough and Dr. Anjum actually cares about her students. I wish that I could take more courses with her.

Absolutely loved this prof! Her lectures are super interesting, very applied, and relatable in the real world socially and personally. Her lectures and assignments were fun and easy to follow. I personally studied a lot but honestly, the lectures helped immensely. She always provided recordings of the sessions which was very helpful.

I enjoyed taking psyc 391 with prof. Anjum. She is really knowledgeable about so many cultures and the course content. I enjoyed her course very much because of how to clearly she teaches. In addition to regular classes she holds many office hours. She is definitely one of the best profs at SFU.
She is a very passionate professor and it's evident in her lectures. Her course was well structured, with a clear rubric to follow and with plenty of room for creativity.
She is an extremely friendly professor. She is very understanding and always there for you when you need help.

Thank you so much, Dr. Gulnaz and the TAs. This was my favorite course this semester. I am immensely grateful to you for all the amazing lectures. I don't think any professor has been as supportive as you. Thank you for your fair grading and kindness.
Thanks for everything, you've gone above and beyond in helping me do well on this course. This was by far the most important course on environment and climate change. Thanks for inspiring me.

It was my first course with Dr. Anjum. I am very grateful to her for her patience and understanding as it has helped me cope through this difficult semester. She is the best professor one can ask for.

I admire how passionate Dr. Anjum is in teaching the topic of sustainability, but unfortunately I found her way of teaching to be somewhat disorganized and tended to focus on tiny details rather than psychological theories as a whole. Contacting her via email was also difficult as she wouldn't respond despite follow-up emails.

She is a very fair marker, and she is very passionate about the course topic. Exams are open book, provided clear criteria and very detailed description about the assignments. the contents may seem overwhelming if you don't stay top of the lectures.

I can definitely tell how passionate Gulnaz is about the subject. However, I found her lectures hard to follow and her lecture slides were very vague and gave me the impression they were put together last minute (lots of typos). The course overall felt very disorganized.

Gulnaz is passionate about environmental sustainability, which clearly shows through her lectures. She is sort of hard to follow in her lectures, and I found it really hard to get the point of what she was saying. Exams are open book but are mostly based on findings of specific studies that were briefly mentioned in lecture, so take detailed notes
I love Dr. Anjum's classes. She is the best prof. at SFU. Her lectures are calm, funny, focused and helpful.

She is a very knowledgeable and caring professor. For the environmental sustainability course, she provided an easy assignment for 3 extra percentage assignment so that students can boost their grades. Since the contents can get heavy, she made the exams open book. The TAs also mark fairly.
Excellent course and brilliant professor in every possible way. She is the most kind, funny, and accommodating professor.
This was one of my favorite courses. I will definitely take more courses with her.

Although the course was only online, Gulnaz is very accessible and supportive professor. Her approach is rather non traditional and more inclusive. She is a professor who talks about global research and cultural approaches. I wish she was teaching many more courses.

A very competent, fair, and highly knowledgeable professor. I have taken two classes with her, and both classes were very engaging. If I could find a way to get into all her classes I definitely would. Thank you Dr Gulnaz!
She is an inspiring professor who is equally caring.

She is an inspiring professor, her classes are highly engaging and fun to sit through. Her term project is exciting and it makes you care about the planet. She is such a charming and energetic professor.
Great professor with meaningful content and discussions.

Absolutely adore Professor Anjum. She has been an amazing professor in my last course as well as in this course. She goes out of her way to support students who need special accommodations. One of the few professors who are so easy to reach.
Professor Anjum is a wonderful professor. Regardless of being a tough grader she has certain charm in her classes and her office hours.
Dr Anjum is one of my favorite professors in the psychology department. She teaches more research than any other professor in her classes. She is motivating and inspirining.

She is a great professor and only she can talk about so many cultures, places, and people. The papers she shares were great but I am not a fan of the book that was used in this course. Next time she should teach only papers and no books.
Very caring and smart professor. One professor whose classes I don't want to miss.
A professor full of ideas and inspiration.
She is really competent in her subject and also knows how to inspire, respect and teach her students.
A fun professor who can teach dark courses like climate change and yet keep us all up and engaged.
Dr. Gulnaz is a wonderful professor. This is also a great course and well taught. The TAs are also good in this course. Everyone seems to be taking climate very seriously which is great.

Gulnaz is a great addition to psychology professors. I love her classes and I am taking another course now. It is great to see how she changes her tempo depending upon the nature of course. In Psy366 she is an impressive activist and yet a cool professor. I am a minority student and I love that she talks about diverse issues. Much respect for her.
Such an amazing professor! I'm hoping in the future she will teach more classes because she is really great!

She is a great professor. Her lecture is very interesting. She engages with students throughout her lectures and outside lectures. She makes the content of her lectures easy to understand. Her exams are fair for those of us who attend classes and study. I like that!

Gulnaz is my favorite professor at SFU even though she is among the new professors! Her teaching is densely packed with a lot of information and everything is really well explained. Her grading is slightly tough but she is a fair grader.

Dr. Gulnaz Anjun is a very passionate and compassionate professor. I haven't taken many courses with her but this course on Sustainability & Psychology was worth every minute that I spent in her classes and weekly assignments.
A tough but caring professor. You will have to sweat a lot before you can hope for a perfect grade.
As a prof Dr. Anjum was great but to be honest I was not too happy with the textbook for this course.

Loved this course but there was one downside, we had too much homework for this course. She gave us weekly assignments which was a lot of additional work. She was kind and respectful. She spent way more time in classes than other profs at SFU.

I loved this class because this was a different experience than mundane teaching. This professor is one of few non White professors in psych department and she shares good amount of experience from other cultures. Many likes for this course. I am taking my second course with her now.

Prof. Anjum was a great professor for this course. Her lectures were interesting but very long. If you sign up for this course then get ready to know a lot about cross-cultural research and long intense lectures in all classes.
For a cross-cultural psychology, we needed a person who has knowledge of diverse cultures. Liked her non-traditional approach in the classroom.
She is by far the best and most humanistic professor at SFU. We need more people like her who teach all their classes and care about creative thinking and student learning.
She is the most inspirational teacher I have ever come across.
Hardworking and Caring. Cares a lot about students' learning and wellbeing.
Absolutely amazing teacher.
She is the best Professor ever. Extremely caring and professional in her teaching approach.

Gulnaz is all over the place, is specific on fine detail that is irrelevant and there's lots of outside of lecture components that don't back up what she says. She might know the material but doesn't know how to teach. Test questions (MC) are worded dumb and SA she is looking for very specific things from lecture/slides. Won't be taking her again

As mentioned, there is room for improvement. Also not equally accessible to all students outside of class time. Tends to only respond back to very few, selected emails. Gives unclear instructions for assignments and overall not engaging. Definitely hard to focus when every other word is "um you know"

Professor Anjum is very caring and accommodates her students' choices. She provided more than enough time for both midterm and final so that students can comfortably participate. As she is a new professor, there are room for improvements, such as the lecture can be more engaging. If you follow her lectures, you will do well in the class.

I used to think professors were highly intelligent and well educated, but after taking a class with Gulnaz, I realize that is not true. If you choose to take a class with her after reading all these reviews, maybe you deserve her.
I just want to talk to the person who gave her the job because wow she's terrible.
Awful prof. Lecture is straight from the textbook and slides are snippets of the textbook. Not organized and forgets to record lectures. Do not recommend and avoid at all costs if you can!

Sweet but disorganized. Changed the grading scheme that was outlined on the syllabus AFTER marking final exams without announcing it to the class and refused to take any questions/offer feedback on the final exam. Lecture content was contradictory to the textbook and MC was either from lecture or textbook content; you never know which she wants.

The lectures are long and dry. Material on the slides are sentences straight from the textbook. Lecture doesn't always match what is presented on the slides. Assigns a lot of extra material on top of weekly textbook readings. Assignment criteria is confusing. Pay special attention to profs published work - it will show up on tests.

This professor just reads you the textbook, which is not acceptable imo for an upper div psychology class. There is not anything particularly interesting about the way she teaches, it is super dry and boring.
